message_1: A digital signature algorithm uses a 2048-bit key size. If the algorithm can generate 10,000 signatures per second, how long will it take to generate 1 billion digital signatures?
message_2:
To find out how long it will take to generate 1 billion digital signatures, we can use the following formula:

Time = Total number of signatures / Signatures generated per second

Time = 1,000,000,000 signatures / 10,000 signatures per second

Time = 100,000 seconds

To convert seconds to hours, we can divide by 3600 (since there are 3600 seconds in an hour):

Time = 100,000 seconds / 3600 seconds per hour

So, it will take approximately 27.78 hours to generate 1 billion digital signatures.
